message_1: Using the concept of Orthogonal Arrays, a company wants to test four variables with three possible settings each to determine which combination produces the best product. How many experiments will the company need to conduct to test all possible combinations?
message_2:
To test all possible combinations of four variables with three possible settings each, the company would need to conduct 3^4 experiments. 

3^4 = 3 × 3 × 3 × 3 = 81

So, the company needs to conduct 81 experiments to test all possible combinations.
